name: Playa Fiesta BeachClub & Hotel

reviews.text: In December 2005 my then boyfriend and I longed for a winter escape to Puerto Vallarta and luckily discovered a boutique hotel named Playa Fiesta. We learned via the internet that the hotel specialized in destination weddings, but at the time our biggest thrill was finding that that particular week happened to be the one (very RARE) week that they didn't actually have a wedding planned, so we were able to book a five day stay there......we were blown away, by the beauty, the charm, the quaintness, and the phenomenal staff....fast foward us getting engaged 1 1/2 months later, and our choice was clear...the Playa Fiesta had to be our destination wedding spot!
reviews.title: My Playa Fiesta Wedding!

reviews.text: So in the end of September 2006 my fiance and i, along with 40 of our closest friends and family, returned for our wedding week....which was more than we could have asked for. Since we were now there not just for a vacation, but for our big day, i worried that would be stressful, but Lindsay, Ivan and the rest of the staff put all such thoughts to rest. The boutique hotel is just charming, and the size of it allows for the wedding week to truly be personal and intimate (which is usually what you strive for in a destination wedding, right?!?). All of our guests, many who were meeting each other for the first time, we able to all hang out in relaxed atmosphere and get to know each other--since we had the entire place to ourselves. The pool/lounge area is great, the hotel decor is beautiful and very Mexican ; ), and the food is divine. After every meal all our friends and family were raving.
reviews.title: Just be Warned
Wedding at Playa Fiesta
reviews.text: And our wedding day went off without a hitch. Lindsay is a phenonemal coordinator who makes sure every detail is addressed and taken care of, and most importantly, that the day is all about the couple. My husband and I have demanding jobs and with only 6 months to plan a wedding, it was great to have a coordinator like Lindsay who can juggle all the wedding tasks for the bride who happens to be 1000 miles away and very busy. It was so great to arrive at the Playa Fiesta and with only having email exchanges and a few phone calls with Lindsay, find that all of my wedding wishes and ideas were already taken care of....

I saw that some people had stated that they had issues in regard to the "unequal" rooms, and their disappointment, but the website is very clear that there are different types of rooms, i.e. standard to penthouse, and being that it is a "boutique hotel" in Mexico, you have to come to expect that there will be variances in room sizes/accomadations, etc....that is part of the charm. (i.e. if you want generic hotel rooms where there is no discrepency--plan a big "Dreams" Resort wedding) Furthermore, all of our friends were really indifferent in what room they were assigned because most of your time is spent outside of your rooms---well at least i hope so, because the Playa Fiesta and Puerto Vallarta are just too beautiful to not take full advantage of!
reviews.title: The Perfect Location for our Week long Celebration

likes.disliked: — Leverage their expertise and don't be shy about your needs

reviews.text: To get to the point, if you want a quaint and charming Mexican wedding destination spot in a beautiful locale, where you'll know the entire staff by name (even the hotel dogs!), you have to do little planning because your coordinator has everything down to a science, and you and your family and friends will leave feeling like you just had the most relaxing and fun wedding week ever, then Playa Fiesta is for you....a month later, I am still beaming!
reviews.title: Best Vacation/Wedding Ever

reviews.text: My daughter had her wedding at the Playa Fiesta. She and her husband had decided that they wanted a destination wedding that would be intimate, but that would also be enjoyable and entertaining for the guests. In the end we had 45 adults and 1 infant in our party. Everyone was comfortable from the first day, the atmosphere was relaxing and gorgeous. Our accomodations were roomy, clean and most of them have a view of the ocean. The meals that were provided were excellent.and the wedding dinner was wonderful. There are 2 pools at the Playa Fiesta and we utilized both of them. There is also a bar by the pool that was always staffed with a bartender. Everyone was polite and helpful. Adam and Lindsay (the owner and wedding coordinator, respectively) were also available if there were any questions about anything. The person that we all worked with the most was the concierge, Ivan. With our group we kept him busy. If you wanted to go parasailing, deep sea fishing, snorkeling or anything else, he would help you arrange it.
reviews.title: Loved the Playa Fiesta Puerto Vallarta

reviews.text: Playa Fiesta has become a home away from home for me. The first tme I went, now 4 years ago, I fell in love with not only the location but the unique style and beauty of the hotel and the warm and gracious staff. Now, I go back every chance I get.
Throughout the years I have seen the hotel grow and become more and more polished through the owners continual attention to detail, and devotion to making it a perfect experience for their guests.

Best Week Ever!
reviews.text: WOW. We absolutely loved Playa Fiesta. We booked the hotel for our January 2007 wedding, and showed up, sight unseen, with 50 of our friends and family. We spent six days, five nights at Playa Fiesta, and it was honestly the best time of our lives.

reviews.title: Great for the Couple, Only OK for the Guests
reviews.text: First, the hotel itself is beautiful. The entire hotel opens out to the ocean, making the air full of ocean breezes and the sound of the waves on the shore. The rooms themselves are huge. The beds are very comfortable, the showers are clean and large, and most rooms open out with an extraordinary, unblocked ocean view. We had several guests tell us that their room at Playa Fiesta was the nicest hotel room they had ever stayed in.

But what really makes the experience is the staff. Ramon, Charlie (best bartender in the world!), Ivan, and Aldo really went above and beyond to take care of our guests and make sure they all felt comfortable. We had a breakfast buffet every morning that was absolutely delicious and incorporated both Mexican and American favorites (like chilaquiles, pancakes, eggs made to order...), plus fresh squeezed juices and coffee. The little touches throughout the week, like massage day and salsa lessons, were really fun and everyone loved them.
reviews.title: Think it's too good to be true? It's even better than you think...

likes.disliked: — If I had to find something, I'd say the coffee at breakfast could be better

reviews.title: Pocket Paradise
reviews.text: The wedding day itself was magical. Lindsay, the co-owner and wedding coordinator at Playa Fiesta, is the best wedding coordinator anyone could ask for. Throughout the planning process, she answered all of my emails within a couple of hours, which really made planning a destination wedding completely stress free and fun. Once we got to Playa Fiesta, I was so impressed with how well Lindsay had incorporated all of our conversations and really made the wedding a reality. Lindsay and her staff remembered every single little detail, and were extraordinarily organized and professional about executing the wedding. We never had to worry about anything wedding-related the whole week!

The flowers were gorgeous, the margaritas were delicious, the candles and the dance floor were perfect... but my favorite detail was the cake! I assumed we wouldn't be able to get a good American-style wedding cake in Mexico, but I was wrong. Lindsay ordered a gorgeous, three-tier cake with whipped cream frosting and a few flowers on top. We picked strawberry shortcake, chocolate w/ mocha frosting, and Kahlua nut w/ cream cheese frosting for the layers. And wow, it was delicious. Honestly the best wedding cake I have ever had. I had a piece from all three layers!
reviews.title: A Plus Wedding!

reviews.text: My (now) husband Marco and myself vacationed at the Playa Fiesta on December 18 of 2006 to marry. It was absolutely spectacular. We knew it would be wonderful but have felt that our 'marriage' was far more significant than the 'wedding' itself and spent very little time in the planning. Well, as it turns out, we had very little to do as Linsday took care of everything for us! Basically, on the 18th of December, my bridesmaids (2 daughters) and myself showed up at noon and things were already in progress for the sunset wedding. The tables were being set, the room was beautiful, and the wedding area was being prepared. Nothing went unnoticed! The rose petals down the walkway, the fresh flowers, maracas and bows at the place settings. The lights, the candles, the music, the service. Everything was so professional and perfect.
reviews.title: Magnificent Everything!

likes.liked: — the bed - very, very comfortable......oh, plus we were married here!

reviews.text: I have attended MANY weddings in my life and have to say that if I could EVER be apart of another, it would be my greatest pleasure if it were at this location with Lindsay and Adam to run the show. It is now nearly a month later and our guests are still talking of the 'best memories they will ever have' being at the Playa Fiesta. We all have plans to meet here again on one of our anniversary's and cannot wait until that day is arrives. The friends and family that were unable to attend are stunned by the photos that display the sunset and tranquil of this unbelievable spot. .
reviews.title: A Destination Wedding Experience Come True

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Playa Fiesta is a very special place. It has character and personality. It’s not your 5 Star, 30+ floors, with top of the line amenities, but it’s quiet, quaint, colorful, cozy, and just plain beautiful. The staff is friendly, warm, and most, if not all, are willing to bend backwards for the wedding couple and their guests (just ask!) They truly become part of your wedding group. This hotel is incomparable to anything that the states can offer. It’s an affordable place that customizes to your wedding desires. And it is because of Playa Fiesta that we were able to have our dream come true wedding and a wedding that our guests will remember and continue to praise even months after.
reviews.title: A Great TIme at the Playa Fiesta

description: Playa Fiesta is unique in every sense of the word. A true gem situated on the South side of Puerto Vallarta right on the ocean with magnificent views of Banderas Bay. Playa Fiesta caters to Wedding groups & Vacationers. A quaint & intimate resort with full hotel amenities. The onsite Bar & Restaurant are open from 8am-11pm daily.
